2  * Defines a Buffer type that wraps from halide_buffer_t and adds

4  * samples in a halide_buffer_t outside of Halide code. */

45 // A helper to check if a parameter pack is entirely implicitly
46 // int-convertible to use with std::enable_if
47 template<typename... Args>
48 struct AllInts : std::false_type {};
49 
50 template<>
51 struct AllInts<> : std::true_type {};
52 
53 template<typename T, typename... Args>
54 struct AllInts<T, Args...> {
55  static const bool value = std::is_convertible<T, int>::value && AllInts<Args...>::value;
56 };
57 
58 // Floats and doubles are technically implicitly int-convertible, but
59 // doing so produces a warning we treat as an error, so just disallow
60 // it here.
61 template<typename... Args>
62 struct AllInts<float, Args...> : std::false_type {};
63 
64 template<typename... Args>
65 struct AllInts<double, Args...> : std::false_type {};
66 
67 // A helper to detect if there are any zeros in a container
68 namespace Internal {
69 template<typename Container>
70 bool any_zero(const Container &c) {
71  for (int i : c) {
72  if (i == 0) {
73  return true;
74  }
75  }
76  return false;
77 }
78 } // namespace Internal
79 
80 /** A struct acting as a header for allocations owned by the Buffer
81  * class itself. */
82 struct AllocationHeader {
83  void (*deallocate_fn)(void *);
84  std::atomic<int> ref_count;
85 
86  // Note that ref_count always starts at 1
87  AllocationHeader(void (*deallocate_fn)(void *))
88  : deallocate_fn(deallocate_fn), ref_count(1) {
89  }
90 };
91 
92 /** This indicates how to deallocate the device for a Halide::Runtime::Buffer. */
93 enum struct BufferDeviceOwnership : int {
94  Allocated, ///> halide_device_free will be called when device ref count goes to zero
95  WrappedNative, ///> halide_device_detach_native will be called when device ref count goes to zero
96  Unmanaged, ///> No free routine will be called when device ref count goes to zero
97  AllocatedDeviceAndHost, ///> Call device_and_host_free when DevRefCount goes to zero.
98  Cropped, ///> Call halide_device_release_crop when DevRefCount goes to zero.
99 };
100 
101 /** A similar struct for managing device allocations. */
102 struct DeviceRefCount {
103  // This is only ever constructed when there's something to manage,
104  // so start at one.
105  std::atomic<int> count{1};
106  BufferDeviceOwnership ownership{BufferDeviceOwnership::Allocated};
107 };
108 
109 /** A templated Buffer class that wraps halide_buffer_t and adds
110  * functionality. When using Halide from C++, this is the preferred
111  * way to create input and output buffers. The overhead of using this
112  * class relative to a naked halide_buffer_t is minimal - it uses another
113  * ~16 bytes on the stack, and does no dynamic allocations when using
114  * it to represent existing memory of a known maximum dimensionality.
115  *
116  * The template parameter T is the element type. For buffers where the
117  * element type is unknown, or may vary, use void or const void.
118  *
119  * D is the maximum number of dimensions that can be represented using
120  * space inside the class itself. Set it to the maximum dimensionality
121  * you expect this buffer to be. If the actual dimensionality exceeds
122  * this, heap storage is allocated to track the shape of the buffer. D
123  * defaults to 4, which should cover nearly all usage.
124  *
125  * The class optionally allocates and owns memory for the image using
126  * a shared pointer allocated with the provided allocator. If they are
127  * null, malloc and free are used. Any device-side allocation is
128  * considered as owned if and only if the host-side allocation is
129  * owned. */
130 template<typename T = void, int D = 4>
131 class Buffer {
132  /** The underlying halide_buffer_t */
133  halide_buffer_t buf = {0};
134 
135  /** Some in-class storage for shape of the dimensions. */
136  halide_dimension_t shape[D];
137 
138  /** The allocation owned by this Buffer. NULL if the Buffer does not
139  * own the memory. */
140  AllocationHeader *alloc = nullptr;
141 
142  /** A reference count for the device allocation owned by this
143  * buffer. */
144  mutable DeviceRefCount *dev_ref_count = nullptr;
145 
146  /** True if T is of type void or const void */
147  static const bool T_is_void = std::is_same<typename std::remove_const<T>::type, void>::value;
148 
149  /** A type function that adds a const qualifier if T is a const type. */
150  template<typename T2>
151  using add_const_if_T_is_const = typename std::conditional<std::is_const<T>::value, const T2, T2>::type;
152 
153  /** T unless T is (const) void, in which case (const)
154  * uint8_t. Useful for providing return types for operator() */
155  using not_void_T = typename std::conditional<T_is_void,
156  add_const_if_T_is_const<uint8_t>,
157  T>::type;
158 
159  /** T with constness removed. Useful for return type of copy(). */
160  using not_const_T = typename std::remove_const<T>::type;
161 
162  /** The type the elements are stored as. Equal to not_void_T
163  * unless T is a pointer, in which case uint64_t. Halide stores
164  * all pointer types as uint64s internally, even on 32-bit
165  * systems. */
166  using storage_T = typename std::conditional<std::is_pointer<T>::value, uint64_t, not_void_T>::type;
167 
168 public:
169  /** True if the Halide type is not void (or const void). */
170  static constexpr bool has_static_halide_type = !T_is_void;
171 
172  /** Get the Halide type of T. Callers should not use the result if
173  * has_static_halide_type is false. */
174  static halide_type_t static_halide_type() {
175  return halide_type_of<typename std::remove_cv<not_void_T>::type>();
176  }
177 
178  /** Does this Buffer own the host memory it refers to? */
179  bool owns_host_memory() const {
180  return alloc != nullptr;
181  }
182 
183 private:
184  /** Increment the reference count of any owned allocation */
185  void incref() const {
186  if (owns_host_memory()) {
187  alloc->ref_count++;
188  }
189  if (buf.device) {
190  if (!dev_ref_count) {
191  // I seem to have a non-zero dev field but no
192  // reference count for it. I must have been given a
193  // device allocation by a Halide pipeline, and have
194  // never been copied from since. Take sole ownership
195  // of it.
196  dev_ref_count = new DeviceRefCount;
197  }
198  dev_ref_count->count++;
199  }
200  }
201 
202  // Note that this is called "cropped" but can also encompass a slice/embed
203  // operation as well.
204  struct DevRefCountCropped : DeviceRefCount {
205  Buffer<T, D> cropped_from;
206  DevRefCountCropped(const Buffer<T, D> &cropped_from)
207  : cropped_from(cropped_from) {
208  ownership = BufferDeviceOwnership::Cropped;
209  }
210  };
211 
212  /** Setup the device ref count for a buffer to indicate it is a crop (or slice, embed, etc) of cropped_from */
213  void crop_from(const Buffer<T, D> &cropped_from) {
214  assert(dev_ref_count == nullptr);
215  dev_ref_count = new DevRefCountCropped(cropped_from);
216  }
217 
218  /** Decrement the reference count of any owned allocation and free host
219  * and device memory if it hits zero. Sets alloc to nullptr. */
220  void decref() {
221  if (owns_host_memory()) {
222  int new_count = --(alloc->ref_count);
223  if (new_count == 0) {
224  void (*fn)(void *) = alloc->deallocate_fn;
225  alloc->~AllocationHeader();
226  fn(alloc);
227  }
228  buf.host = nullptr;
229  alloc = nullptr;
230  set_host_dirty(false);
231  }
232  decref_dev();
233  }
234 
235  void decref_dev() {
236  int new_count = 0;
237  if (dev_ref_count) {
238  new_count = --(dev_ref_count->count);
239  }
240  if (new_count == 0) {
241  if (buf.device) {
242  assert(!(alloc && device_dirty()) &&
243  "Implicitly freeing a dirty device allocation while a host allocation still lives. "
244  "Call device_free explicitly if you want to drop dirty device-side data. "
245  "Call copy_to_host explicitly if you want the data copied to the host allocation "
246  "before the device allocation is freed.");
247  if (dev_ref_count && dev_ref_count->ownership == BufferDeviceOwnership::WrappedNative) {
248  buf.device_interface->detach_native(nullptr, &buf);
249  } else if (dev_ref_count && dev_ref_count->ownership == BufferDeviceOwnership::AllocatedDeviceAndHost) {
250  buf.device_interface->device_and_host_free(nullptr, &buf);
251  } else if (dev_ref_count && dev_ref_count->ownership == BufferDeviceOwnership::Cropped) {
252  buf.device_interface->device_release_crop(nullptr, &buf);
253  } else if (dev_ref_count == nullptr || dev_ref_count->ownership == BufferDeviceOwnership::Allocated) {
254  buf.device_interface->device_free(nullptr, &buf);
255  }
256  }
257  if (dev_ref_count) {
258  if (dev_ref_count->ownership == BufferDeviceOwnership::Cropped) {
259  delete (DevRefCountCropped *)dev_ref_count;
260  } else {
261  delete dev_ref_count;
262  }
263  }
264  }
265  buf.device = 0;
266  buf.device_interface = nullptr;
267  dev_ref_count = nullptr;
268  }
269 
270  void free_shape_storage() {
271  if (buf.dim != shape) {
272  delete[] buf.dim;
273  buf.dim = nullptr;
274  }
275  }
276 
277  void make_shape_storage(const int dimensions) {
278  // This should usually be inlined, so if dimensions is statically known,
279  // we can skip the call to new
280  buf.dimensions = dimensions;
281  buf.dim = (dimensions <= D) ? shape : new halide_dimension_t[dimensions];
282  }
283 
284  void copy_shape_from(const halide_buffer_t &other) {
285  // All callers of this ensure that buf.dimensions == other.dimensions.
286  make_shape_storage(other.dimensions);
287  std::copy(other.dim, other.dim + other.dimensions, buf.dim);
288  }
289 
290  template<typename T2, int D2>
291  void move_shape_from(Buffer<T2, D2> &&other) {
292  if (other.shape == other.buf.dim) {
293  copy_shape_from(other.buf);
294  } else {
295  buf.dim = other.buf.dim;
296  other.buf.dim = nullptr;
297  }
298  }
299 
300  /** Initialize the shape from a halide_buffer_t. */
301  void initialize_from_buffer(const halide_buffer_t &b,
302  BufferDeviceOwnership ownership) {
303  memcpy(&buf, &b, sizeof(halide_buffer_t));
304  copy_shape_from(b);
305  if (b.device) {
306  dev_ref_count = new DeviceRefCount;
307  dev_ref_count->ownership = ownership;
308  }
309  }
310 
311  /** Initialize the shape from an array of ints */
312  void initialize_shape(const int *sizes) {
313  for (int i = 0; i < buf.dimensions; i++) {
314  buf.dim[i].min = 0;
315  buf.dim[i].extent = sizes[i];
316  if (i == 0) {
317  buf.dim[i].stride = 1;
318  } else {
319  buf.dim[i].stride = buf.dim[i - 1].stride * buf.dim[i - 1].extent;
320  }
321  }
322  }
323 
324  /** Initialize the shape from a vector of extents */
325  void initialize_shape(const std::vector<int> &sizes) {
326  assert(buf.dimensions == (int)sizes.size());
327  initialize_shape(sizes.data());
328  }
329 
330  /** Initialize the shape from the static shape of an array */
331  template<typename Array, size_t N>
332  void initialize_shape_from_array_shape(int next, Array (&vals)[N]) {
333  buf.dim[next].min = 0;
334  buf.dim[next].extent = (int)N;
335  if (next == 0) {
336  buf.dim[next].stride = 1;
337  } else {
338  initialize_shape_from_array_shape(next - 1, vals[0]);
339  buf.dim[next].stride = buf.dim[next - 1].stride * buf.dim[next - 1].extent;
340  }
341  }
342 
343  /** Base case for the template recursion above. */
344  template<typename T2>
345  void initialize_shape_from_array_shape(int, const T2 &) {
346  }
347 
348  /** Get the dimensionality of a multi-dimensional C array */
349  template<typename Array, size_t N>
350  static int dimensionality_of_array(Array (&vals)[N]) {
351  return dimensionality_of_array(vals[0]) + 1;
352  }
353 
354  template<typename T2>
355  static int dimensionality_of_array(const T2 &) {
356  return 0;
357  }
358 
359  /** Get the underlying halide_type_t of an array's element type. */
360  template<typename Array, size_t N>
361  static halide_type_t scalar_type_of_array(Array (&vals)[N]) {
362  return scalar_type_of_array(vals[0]);
363  }
364 
365  template<typename T2>
366  static halide_type_t scalar_type_of_array(const T2 &) {
367  return halide_type_of<typename std::remove_cv<T2>::type>();
368  }
369 
370  /** Crop a single dimension without handling device allocation. */
371  void crop_host(int d, int min, int extent) {
372  assert(dim(d).min() <= min);
373  assert(dim(d).max() >= min + extent - 1);
374  ptrdiff_t shift = min - dim(d).min();
375  if (buf.host != nullptr) {
376  buf.host += (shift * dim(d).stride()) * type().bytes();
377  }
378  buf.dim[d].min = min;
379  buf.dim[d].extent = extent;
380  }
381 
382  /** Crop as many dimensions as are in rect, without handling device allocation. */
383  void crop_host(const std::vector<std::pair<int, int>> &rect) {
384  assert(rect.size() <= static_cast<decltype(rect.size())>(std::numeric_limits<int>::max()));
385  int limit = (int)rect.size();
386  assert(limit <= dimensions());
387  for (int i = 0; i < limit; i++) {
388  crop_host(i, rect[i].first, rect[i].second);
389  }
390  }
391 
392  void complete_device_crop(Buffer<T, D> &result_host_cropped) const {
393  assert(buf.device_interface != nullptr);
394  if (buf.device_interface->device_crop(nullptr, &this->buf, &result_host_cropped.buf) == 0) {
395  const Buffer<T, D> *cropped_from = this;
396  // TODO: Figure out what to do if dev_ref_count is nullptr. Should incref logic run here?
397  // is it possible to get to this point without incref having run at least once since
398  // the device field was set? (I.e. in the internal logic of crop. incref might have been
399  // called.)
400  if (dev_ref_count != nullptr && dev_ref_count->ownership == BufferDeviceOwnership::Cropped) {
401  cropped_from = &((DevRefCountCropped *)dev_ref_count)->cropped_from;
402  }
403  result_host_cropped.crop_from(*cropped_from);
404  }
405  }
406 
407  /** slice a single dimension without handling device allocation. */
408  void slice_host(int d, int pos) {
409  assert(d >= 0 && d < dimensions());
410  assert(pos >= dim(d).min() && pos <= dim(d).max());
411  buf.dimensions--;
412  ptrdiff_t shift = pos - buf.dim[d].min;
413  if (buf.host != nullptr) {
414  buf.host += (shift * buf.dim[d].stride) * type().bytes();
415  }
416  for (int i = d; i < buf.dimensions; i++) {
417  buf.dim[i] = buf.dim[i + 1];
418  }
419  buf.dim[buf.dimensions] = {0, 0, 0};
420  }
421 
422  void complete_device_slice(Buffer<T, D> &result_host_sliced, int d, int pos) const {
423  assert(buf.device_interface != nullptr);
424  if (buf.device_interface->device_slice(nullptr, &this->buf, d, pos, &result_host_sliced.buf) == 0) {
425  const Buffer<T, D> *sliced_from = this;
426  // TODO: Figure out what to do if dev_ref_count is nullptr. Should incref logic run here?
427  // is it possible to get to this point without incref having run at least once since
428  // the device field was set? (I.e. in the internal logic of slice. incref might have been
429  // called.)
430  if (dev_ref_count != nullptr && dev_ref_count->ownership == BufferDeviceOwnership::Cropped) {
431  sliced_from = &((DevRefCountCropped *)dev_ref_count)->cropped_from;
432  }
433  // crop_from() is correct here, despite the fact that we are slicing.
434  result_host_sliced.crop_from(*sliced_from);
435  }
436  }
437 
438 public:
439  typedef T ElemType;
440 
441  /** Read-only access to the shape */
442  class Dimension {
443  const halide_dimension_t &d;
444 
445  public:
446  /** The lowest coordinate in this dimension */
447  HALIDE_ALWAYS_INLINE int min() const {
448  return d.min;
449  }
450 
451  /** The number of elements in memory you have to step over to
452  * increment this coordinate by one. */
453  HALIDE_ALWAYS_INLINE int stride() const {
454  return d.stride;
455  }
456 
457  /** The extent of the image along this dimension */
458  HALIDE_ALWAYS_INLINE int extent() const {
459  return d.extent;
460  }
461 
462  /** The highest coordinate in this dimension */
463  HALIDE_ALWAYS_INLINE int max() const {
464  return min() + extent() - 1;
465  }
466 
467  /** An iterator class, so that you can iterate over
468  * coordinates in a dimensions using a range-based for loop. */
469  struct iterator {
470  int val;
471  int operator*() const {
472  return val;
473  }
474  bool operator!=(const iterator &other) const {
475  return val != other.val;
476  }
477  iterator &operator++() {
478  val++;
479  return *this;
480  }
481  };
482 
483  /** An iterator that points to the min coordinate */
484  HALIDE_ALWAYS_INLINE iterator begin() const {
485  return {min()};
486  }
487 
488  /** An iterator that points to one past the max coordinate */
489  HALIDE_ALWAYS_INLINE iterator end() const {
490  return {min() + extent()};
491  }
492 
493  Dimension(const halide_dimension_t &dim)
494  : d(dim){};
495  };
496 
497  /** Access the shape of the buffer */
498  HALIDE_ALWAYS_INLINE Dimension dim(int i) const {
499  assert(i >= 0 && i < this->dimensions());
500  return Dimension(buf.dim[i]);
501  }
502 
503  /** Access to the mins, strides, extents. Will be deprecated. Do not use. */
504  // @{
505  int min(int i) const {
506  return dim(i).min();
507  }
508  int extent(int i) const {
509  return dim(i).extent();
510  }
511  int stride(int i) const {
512  return dim(i).stride();
513  }
514  // @}
515 
516  /** The total number of elements this buffer represents. Equal to
517  * the product of the extents */
518  size_t number_of_elements() const {
519  size_t s = 1;
520  for (int i = 0; i < dimensions(); i++) {
521  s *= dim(i).extent();
522  }
523  return s;
524  }
525 
526  /** Get the dimensionality of the buffer. */
527  int dimensions() const {
528  return buf.dimensions;
529  }
530 
531  /** Get the type of the elements. */
532  halide_type_t type() const {
533  return buf.type;
534  }
535 
536 private:
537  /** Offset to the element with the lowest address. If all
538  * strides are positive, equal to zero. Offset is in elements, not bytes. */
539  ptrdiff_t begin_offset() const {
540  ptrdiff_t index = 0;
541  for (int i = 0; i < dimensions(); i++) {
542  if (dim(i).stride() < 0) {
543  index += dim(i).stride() * (ptrdiff_t)(dim(i).extent() - 1);
544  }
545  }
546  return index;
547  }
548 
549  /** An offset to one beyond the element with the highest address.
550  * Offset is in elements, not bytes. */
551  ptrdiff_t end_offset() const {
552  ptrdiff_t index = 0;
553  for (int i = 0; i < dimensions(); i++) {
554  if (dim(i).stride() > 0) {
555  index += dim(i).stride() * (ptrdiff_t)(dim(i).extent() - 1);
556  }
557  }
558  index += 1;
559  return index;
560  }
561 
562 public:
563  /** A pointer to the element with the lowest address. If all
564  * strides are positive, equal to the host pointer. */
565  T *begin() const {
566  assert(buf.host != nullptr); // Cannot call begin() on an unallocated Buffer.
567  return (T *)(buf.host + begin_offset() * type().bytes());
568  }
569 
570  /** A pointer to one beyond the element with the highest address. */
571  T *end() const {
572  assert(buf.host != nullptr); // Cannot call end() on an unallocated Buffer.
573  return (T *)(buf.host + end_offset() * type().bytes());
574  }
575 
576  /** The total number of bytes spanned by the data in memory. */
577  size_t size_in_bytes() const {
578  return (size_t)(end_offset() - begin_offset()) * type().bytes();
579  }
580 
581  /** Reset the Buffer to be equivalent to a default-constructed Buffer
582  * of the same static type (if any); Buffer<void> will have its runtime
583  * type reset to uint8. */
584  void reset() {
585  *this = Buffer();
586  }
587 
588  Buffer()
589  : shape() {
590  buf.type = static_halide_type();
591  make_shape_storage(0);
592  }
593 
594  /** Make a Buffer from a halide_buffer_t */
595  explicit Buffer(const halide_buffer_t &buf,
596  BufferDeviceOwnership ownership = BufferDeviceOwnership::Unmanaged) {
597  assert(T_is_void || buf.type == static_halide_type());
598  initialize_from_buffer(buf, ownership);
599  }
600 
601  /** Give Buffers access to the members of Buffers of different dimensionalities and types. */
602  template<typename T2, int D2>
603  friend class Buffer;
604 
605 private:
606  template<typename T2, int D2>
607  static void static_assert_can_convert_from() {
608  static_assert((!std::is_const<T2>::value || std::is_const<T>::value),
609  "Can't convert from a Buffer<const T> to a Buffer<T>");
610  static_assert(std::is_same<typename std::remove_const<T>::type,
611  typename std::remove_const<T2>::type>::value ||
612  T_is_void || Buffer<T2, D2>::T_is_void,
613  "type mismatch constructing Buffer");
614  }
615 
616 public:
617  /** Determine if if an Buffer<T, D> can be constructed from some other Buffer type.
618  * If this can be determined at compile time, fail with a static assert; otherwise
619  * return a boolean based on runtime typing. */
620  template<typename T2, int D2>
621  static bool can_convert_from(const Buffer<T2, D2> &other) {
622  static_assert_can_convert_from<T2, D2>();
623  if (Buffer<T2, D2>::T_is_void && !T_is_void) {
624  return other.type() == static_halide_type();
625  }
626  return true;
627  }
628 
629  /** Fail an assertion at runtime or compile-time if an Buffer<T, D>
630  * cannot be constructed from some other Buffer type. */
631  template<typename T2, int D2>
632  static void assert_can_convert_from(const Buffer<T2, D2> &other) {
633  // Explicitly call static_assert_can_convert_from() here so
634  // that we always get compile-time checking, even if compiling with
635  // assertions disabled.
636  static_assert_can_convert_from<T2, D2>();
637  assert(can_convert_from(other));
638  }
639 
640  /** Copy constructor. Does not copy underlying data. */
641  Buffer(const Buffer<T, D> &other)
642  : buf(other.buf),
643  alloc(other.alloc) {
644  other.incref();
645  dev_ref_count = other.dev_ref_count;
646  copy_shape_from(other.buf);
647  }
648 
649  /** Construct a Buffer from a Buffer of different dimensionality
650  * and type. Asserts that the type matches (at runtime, if one of
651  * the types is void). Note that this constructor is
652  * implicit. This, for example, lets you pass things like
653  * Buffer<T> or Buffer<const void> to functions expected
654  * Buffer<const T>. */
655  template<typename T2, int D2>
656  Buffer(const Buffer<T2, D2> &other)
657  : buf(other.buf),
658  alloc(other.alloc) {
659  assert_can_convert_from(other);
660  other.incref();
661  dev_ref_count = other.dev_ref_count;
662  copy_shape_from(other.buf);
663  }
664 
665  /** Move constructor */
666  Buffer(Buffer<T, D> &&other) noexcept
667  : buf(other.buf),
668  alloc(other.alloc),
669  dev_ref_count(other.dev_ref_count) {
670  other.dev_ref_count = nullptr;
671  other.alloc = nullptr;
672  move_shape_from(std::forward<Buffer<T, D>>(other));
673  other.buf = halide_buffer_t();
674  }
675 
676  /** Move-construct a Buffer from a Buffer of different
677  * dimensionality and type. Asserts that the types match (at
678  * runtime if one of the types is void). */
679  template<typename T2, int D2>
680  Buffer(Buffer<T2, D2> &&other)
681  : buf(other.buf),
682  alloc(other.alloc),
683  dev_ref_count(other.dev_ref_count) {
684  assert_can_convert_from(other);
685  other.dev_ref_count = nullptr;
686  other.alloc = nullptr;
687  move_shape_from(std::forward<Buffer<T2, D2>>(other));
688  other.buf = halide_buffer_t();
689  }
690 
691  /** Assign from another Buffer of possibly-different
692  * dimensionality and type. Asserts that the types match (at
693  * runtime if one of the types is void). */
694  template<typename T2, int D2>
695  Buffer<T, D> &operator=(const Buffer<T2, D2> &other) {
696  if ((const void *)this == (const void *)&other) {
697  return *this;
698  }
699  assert_can_convert_from(other);
700  other.incref();
701  decref();
702  dev_ref_count = other.dev_ref_count;
703  alloc = other.alloc;
704  free_shape_storage();
705  buf = other.buf;
706  copy_shape_from(other.buf);
707  return *this;
708  }
709 
710  /** Standard assignment operator */
711  Buffer<T, D> &operator=(const Buffer<T, D> &other) {
712  // The cast to void* here is just to satisfy clang-tidy
713  if ((const void *)this == (const void *)&other) {
714  return *this;
715  }
716  other.incref();
717  decref();
718  dev_ref_count = other.dev_ref_count;
719  alloc = other.alloc;
720  free_shape_storage();
721  buf = other.buf;
722  copy_shape_from(other.buf);
723  return *this;
724  }
725 
726  /** Move from another Buffer of possibly-different
727  * dimensionality and type. Asserts that the types match (at
728  * runtime if one of the types is void). */
729  template<typename T2, int D2>
730  Buffer<T, D> &operator=(Buffer<T2, D2> &&other) {
731  assert_can_convert_from(other);
732  decref();
733  alloc = other.alloc;
734  other.alloc = nullptr;
735  dev_ref_count = other.dev_ref_count;
736  other.dev_ref_count = nullptr;
737  free_shape_storage();
738  buf = other.buf;
739  move_shape_from(std::forward<Buffer<T2, D2>>(other));
740  other.buf = halide_buffer_t();
741  return *this;
742  }
743 
744  /** Standard move-assignment operator */
745  Buffer<T, D> &operator=(Buffer<T, D> &&other) noexcept {
746  decref();
747  alloc = other.alloc;
748  other.alloc = nullptr;
749  dev_ref_count = other.dev_ref_count;
750  other.dev_ref_count = nullptr;
751  free_shape_storage();
752  buf = other.buf;
753  move_shape_from(std::forward<Buffer<T, D>>(other));
754  other.buf = halide_buffer_t();
755  return *this;
756  }
757 
758  /** Check the product of the extents fits in memory. */
759  void check_overflow() {
760  size_t size = type().bytes();
761  for (int i = 0; i < dimensions(); i++) {
762  size *= dim(i).extent();
763  }
764  // We allow 2^31 or 2^63 bytes, so drop the top bit.
765  size = (size << 1) >> 1;
766  for (int i = 0; i < dimensions(); i++) {
767  size /= dim(i).extent();
768  }
769  assert(size == (size_t)type().bytes() && "Error: Overflow computing total size of buffer.");
770  }
771 
772  /** Allocate memory for this Buffer. Drops the reference to any
773  * owned memory. */
774  void allocate(void *(*allocate_fn)(size_t) = nullptr,
775  void (*deallocate_fn)(void *) = nullptr) {
776  if (!allocate_fn) {
777  allocate_fn = malloc;
778  }
779  if (!deallocate_fn) {
780  deallocate_fn = free;
781  }
782 
783  // Drop any existing allocation
784  deallocate();
785 
786  // Conservatively align images to 128 bytes. This is enough
787  // alignment for all the platforms we might use.
788  size_t size = size_in_bytes();
789  const size_t alignment = 128;
790  size = (size + alignment - 1) & ~(alignment - 1);
791  void *alloc_storage = allocate_fn(size + sizeof(AllocationHeader) + alignment - 1);
792  alloc = new (alloc_storage) AllocationHeader(deallocate_fn);
793  uint8_t *unaligned_ptr = ((uint8_t *)alloc) + sizeof(AllocationHeader);
794  buf.host = (uint8_t *)((uintptr_t)(unaligned_ptr + alignment - 1) & ~(alignment - 1));
795  }
796 
797  /** Drop reference to any owned host or device memory, possibly
798  * freeing it, if this buffer held the last reference to
799  * it. Retains the shape of the buffer. Does nothing if this
800  * buffer did not allocate its own memory. */
801  void deallocate() {
802  decref();
803  }
804 
805  /** Drop reference to any owned device memory, possibly freeing it
806  * if this buffer held the last reference to it. Asserts that
807  * device_dirty is false. */
808  void device_deallocate() {
809  decref_dev();
810  }
811 
812  /** Allocate a new image of the given size with a runtime
813  * type. Only used when you do know what size you want but you
814  * don't know statically what type the elements are. Pass zeroes
815  * to make a buffer suitable for bounds query calls. */
816  template<typename... Args,
817  typename = typename std::enable_if<AllInts<Args...>::value>::type>
818  Buffer(halide_type_t t, int first, Args... rest) {
819  if (!T_is_void) {
820  assert(static_halide_type() == t);
821  }
822  int extents[] = {first, (int)rest...};
823  buf.type = t;
824  constexpr int buf_dimensions = 1 + (int)(sizeof...(rest));
825  make_shape_storage(buf_dimensions);
826  initialize_shape(extents);
827  if (!Internal::any_zero(extents)) {
828  check_overflow();
829  allocate();
830  }
831  }
832 
833  /** Allocate a new image of the given size. Pass zeroes to make a
834  * buffer suitable for bounds query calls. */
835  // @{
836 
837  // The overload with one argument is 'explicit', so that
838  // (say) int is not implicitly convertable to Buffer<int>
839  explicit Buffer(int first) {
840  static_assert(!T_is_void,
841  "To construct an Buffer<void>, pass a halide_type_t as the first argument to the constructor");
842  int extents[] = {first};
843  buf.type = static_halide_type();
844  constexpr int buf_dimensions = 1;
845  make_shape_storage(buf_dimensions);
846  initialize_shape(extents);
847  if (first != 0) {
848  check_overflow();
849  allocate();
850  }
851  }
852 
853  template<typename... Args,
854  typename = typename std::enable_if<AllInts<Args...>::value>::type>
855  Buffer(int first, int second, Args... rest) {
856  static_assert(!T_is_void,
857  "To construct an Buffer<void>, pass a halide_type_t as the first argument to the constructor");
858  int extents[] = {first, second, (int)rest...};
859  buf.type = static_halide_type();
860  constexpr int buf_dimensions = 2 + (int)(sizeof...(rest));
861  make_shape_storage(buf_dimensions);
862  initialize_shape(extents);
863  if (!Internal::any_zero(extents)) {
864  check_overflow();
865  allocate();
866  }
867  }
868  // @}
869 
870  /** Allocate a new image of unknown type using a vector of ints as the size. */
871  Buffer(halide_type_t t, const std::vector<int> &sizes) {
872  if (!T_is_void) {
873  assert(static_halide_type() == t);
874  }
875  buf.type = t;
876  make_shape_storage((int)sizes.size());
877  initialize_shape(sizes);
878  if (!Internal::any_zero(sizes)) {
879  check_overflow();
880  allocate();
881  }
882  }
883 
884  /** Allocate a new image of known type using a vector of ints as the size. */
885  explicit Buffer(const std::vector<int> &sizes)
886  : Buffer(static_halide_type(), sizes) {
887  }
888 
889 private:
890  // Create a copy of the sizes vector, ordered as specified by order.
891  static std::vector<int> make_ordered_sizes(const std::vector<int> &sizes, const std::vector<int> &order) {
892  assert(order.size() == sizes.size());
893  std::vector<int> ordered_sizes(sizes.size());
894  for (size_t i = 0; i < sizes.size(); ++i) {
895  ordered_sizes[i] = sizes.at(order[i]);
896  }
897  return ordered_sizes;
898  }
899 
900 public:
901  /** Allocate a new image of unknown type using a vector of ints as the size and
902  * a vector of indices indicating the storage order for each dimension. The
903  * length of the sizes vector and the storage-order vector must match. For instance,
904  * to allocate an interleaved RGB buffer, you would pass {2, 0, 1} for storage_order. */
905  Buffer(halide_type_t t, const std::vector<int> &sizes, const std::vector<int> &storage_order)
906  : Buffer(t, make_ordered_sizes(sizes, storage_order)) {
907  transpose(storage_order);
908  }
909 
910  Buffer(const std::vector<int> &sizes, const std::vector<int> &storage_order)
911  : Buffer(static_halide_type(), sizes, storage_order) {
912  }
913 
914  /** Make an Buffer that refers to a statically sized array. Does not
915  * take ownership of the data, and does not set the host_dirty flag. */
916  template<typename Array, size_t N>
917  explicit Buffer(Array (&vals)[N]) {
918  const int buf_dimensions = dimensionality_of_array(vals);
919  buf.type = scalar_type_of_array(vals);
920  buf.host = (uint8_t *)vals;
921  make_shape_storage(buf_dimensions);
922  initialize_shape_from_array_shape(buf.dimensions - 1, vals);
923  }
924 
925  /** Initialize an Buffer of runtime type from a pointer and some
926  * sizes. Assumes dense row-major packing and a min coordinate of
927  * zero. Does not take ownership of the data and does not set the
928  * host_dirty flag. */
929  template<typename... Args,
930  typename = typename std::enable_if<AllInts<Args...>::value>::type>
931  explicit Buffer(halide_type_t t, add_const_if_T_is_const<void> *data, int first, Args &&...rest) {
932  if (!T_is_void) {
933  assert(static_halide_type() == t);
934  }
935  int extents[] = {first, (int)rest...};
936  buf.type = t;
937  constexpr int buf_dimensions = 1 + (int)(sizeof...(rest));
938  buf.host = (uint8_t *)const_cast<void *>(data);
939  make_shape_storage(buf_dimensions);
940  initialize_shape(extents);
941  }
942 
943  /** Initialize an Buffer from a pointer and some sizes. Assumes
944  * dense row-major packing and a min coordinate of zero. Does not
945  * take ownership of the data and does not set the host_dirty flag. */
946  template<typename... Args,
947  typename = typename std::enable_if<AllInts<Args...>::value>::type>
948  explicit Buffer(T *data, int first, Args &&...rest) {
949  int extents[] = {first, (int)rest...};
950  buf.type = static_halide_type();
951  constexpr int buf_dimensions = 1 + (int)(sizeof...(rest));
952  buf.host = (uint8_t *)const_cast<typename std::remove_const<T>::type *>(data);
953  make_shape_storage(buf_dimensions);
954  initialize_shape(extents);
955  }
956 
957  /** Initialize an Buffer from a pointer and a vector of
958  * sizes. Assumes dense row-major packing and a min coordinate of
959  * zero. Does not take ownership of the data and does not set the
960  * host_dirty flag. */
961  explicit Buffer(T *data, const std::vector<int> &sizes) {
962  buf.type = static_halide_type();
963  buf.host = (uint8_t *)const_cast<typename std::remove_const<T>::type *>(data);
964  make_shape_storage((int)sizes.size());
965  initialize_shape(sizes);
966  }
967 
968  /** Initialize an Buffer of runtime type from a pointer and a
969  * vector of sizes. Assumes dense row-major packing and a min
970  * coordinate of zero. Does not take ownership of the data and
971  * does not set the host_dirty flag. */
972  explicit Buffer(halide_type_t t, add_const_if_T_is_const<void> *data, const std::vector<int> &sizes) {
973  if (!T_is_void) {
974  assert(static_halide_type() == t);
975  }
976  buf.type = t;
977  buf.host = (uint8_t *)const_cast<void *>(data);
978  make_shape_storage((int)sizes.size());
979  initialize_shape(sizes);
980  }
981 
982  /** Initialize an Buffer from a pointer to the min coordinate and
983  * an array describing the shape. Does not take ownership of the
984  * data, and does not set the host_dirty flag. */
985  explicit Buffer(halide_type_t t, add_const_if_T_is_const<void> *data, int d, const halide_dimension_t *shape) {
986  if (!T_is_void) {
987  assert(static_halide_type() == t);
988  }
989  buf.type = t;
990  buf.host = (uint8_t *)const_cast<void *>(data);
991  make_shape_storage(d);
992  for (int i = 0; i < d; i++) {
993  buf.dim[i] = shape[i];
994  }
995  }
996 
997  /** Initialize a Buffer from a pointer to the min coordinate and
998  * a vector describing the shape. Does not take ownership of the
999  * data, and does not set the host_dirty flag. */
1000  explicit inline Buffer(halide_type_t t, add_const_if_T_is_const<void> *data,
1001  const std::vector<halide_dimension_t> &shape)
1002  : Buffer(t, data, (int)shape.size(), shape.data()) {
1003  }

1005  /** Initialize an Buffer from a pointer to the min coordinate and
1006  * an array describing the shape. Does not take ownership of the
1007  * data and does not set the host_dirty flag. */
1008  explicit Buffer(T *data, int d, const halide_dimension_t *shape) {
1009  buf.type = static_halide_type();
1010  buf.host = (uint8_t *)const_cast<typename std::remove_const<T>::type *>(data);
1011  make_shape_storage(d);
1012  for (int i = 0; i < d; i++) {
1013  buf.dim[i] = shape[i];
1014  }
1015  }

1017  /** Initialize a Buffer from a pointer to the min coordinate and
1018  * a vector describing the shape. Does not take ownership of the
1019  * data, and does not set the host_dirty flag. */
1020  explicit inline Buffer(T *data, const std::vector<halide_dimension_t> &shape)
1021  : Buffer(data, (int)shape.size(), shape.data()) {
1022  }

1024  /** Destructor. Will release any underlying owned allocation if
1025  * this is the last reference to it. Will assert fail if there are
1026  * weak references to this Buffer outstanding. */
1027  ~Buffer() {
1028  free_shape_storage();
1029  decref();
1030  }
